item.description:

item.title: Why Video is Moving to H.264
item.description:
Digital video is gaining immense popularity and rapidly consuming internet bandwidth. It’s revolutionizing television, expanding its presence on the internet, and being adopted by businesses for cost reduction, productivity gains, and environmental benefits. However, its major drawback is its heavy bandwidth consumption. H.264, a video coding standard, addresses this issue by offering high-quality video at lower bandwidths through compression.
